questions.question: What is the key difference between an AI agent and an automation?
options: Agents use AI, automations do not.
Agents follow a predefined sequence, automations dynamically decide how to complete tasks.
Agents dynamically decide how to complete tasks, automations follow a predefined sequence.
There is no significant difference; the terms are interchangeable.
questions.answer: Agents dynamically decide how to complete tasks, automations follow a predefined sequence.

questions.question: What are the three key components of an AI agent?
options: Processor, memory, and storage
Brain, memory, and tools
Input, processing, and output
Hardware, software, and network

questions.question: What is the role of the 'brain' in an AI agent?
options: To store past interactions and context
To interact with the outside world
To handle reasoning, planning, and language generation
To manage workflows and delegate tasks
questions.answer: To handle reasoning, planning, and language generation

questions.question: What is the purpose of 'guardrails' in an AI agent?
options: To improve the agent's speed and efficiency
To prevent the agent from making bad decisions or hallucinating
To enhance the agent's ability to learn and adapt
To facilitate communication between the agent and external systems
questions.answer: To prevent the agent from making bad decisions or hallucinating

questions.question: According to the transcript, what is the best place to start when building AI agents?
options: With a multi-agent system
With a single agent system
By building a complex system and simplifying later
By using pre-built templates and tools
